p: A study from a non-high-epidemic area of Japan analyzed the results from 21 patients suspected to have COVID-19 at CT scans at least 3 days after symptom onset [ 6]. Six patients out of 21 had positive RT-PCR and 15 were proven to have other causes of the symptoms (Moraxella, legionella, pneumocystis, etc.). The sensitivity of the two raters was 67% and 83%, and the specificity 93% and 80%.
